results.title: Ke Huy Quan: From Short Round to Romantic Lead in Just Four Long Decades
results.abstract: A child star in the 1980s, he hit a dry patch and turned to stunt work in the 2000s. Now he has returned to acting in a part that blends his action and drama chops.

multimedia.caption: “I didn’t grow up wanting to be an actor,” Ke Huy Quan said. When he was older and determined to act, “there were just not a lot of offers.”
multimedia.copyright: Jennelle Fong for The New York Times

results.title: Cole Sprouse on Finding a Healthy Balance in Hollywood
results.abstract: The former child actor wanted to leave showbiz. Now, the “Moonshot” and “Riverdale” star is finding he can act and tend his photography career as well.

multimedia.caption: Cole Sprouse in “Moonshot.” The former Disney Channel mainstay said, “When we talk about child stars going nuts, what we’re not actually talking about is how fame is a trauma.”
Cole Sprouse in “Moonshot.” The former Disney Channel mainstay said, “When we talk about child stars going nuts, what we’re not actually talking about is how fame is a trauma.”

results.title: Kim’s Video Is Back. What Even Is a Video Store in 2022?
results.abstract: Alamo Drafthouse made a deal for the seminal New York chain’s collection in an effort to turn rentals into draw for moviegoers. Can one disrupted business help another?
results.byline: By Gabe Cohn and Adam Powell

multimedia.caption: The boxes and videos were separated at the original Kim’s. The Alamo team matched them up again.
The boxes and videos were separated at the original Kim’s. The Alamo team matched them up again.

results.title: Caleb Landry Jones Can Do This
results.abstract: The actor — whose latest film, the Australian drama “Nitram,” earned him a top prize at Cannes — discusses his distinctive career in challenging roles.

results.title: Even a Broken Femur Can’t Stop Tony Hawk
results.abstract: A documentary chronicles the challenges of Hawk’s skating career. He sat down to discuss the devastating leg injury that made promoting it (and walking) a challenge.
des_facet: Tony Hawk: Until the Wheels Fall Off (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Jones's vision for what a documentary about Hawk could be was what convinced Hawk to participate.
Jones's vision for what a documentary about Hawk could be was what convinced Hawk to participate.
Jones's vision for what a documentary about Hawk could be was what convinced Hawk to participate.

results.title: ‘Morbius’ Review: The Other Bat, Man
results.abstract: Jared Leto bares his teeth as a neo-vampire who walks by day and tries to keep his monstrous thirst at bay in the latest Marvel adaptation.

multimedia.caption: Jared Leto as Michael Morbius, the latest marginal Marvel character to get a big-screen close-up.

results.title: Russia and Ukraine Have Long Been This Filmmaker’s Subject
results.abstract: In documentaries and fictional features, including two timely new movies, Sergei Loznitsa takes a hard look at both countries, examining daily life amid war and other historic forces.

results.title: One Last Takeaway From ‘The Slap’: Leave Black Women’s Hair Alone
results.abstract: Lost in the Oscars fray is the hurt inflicted when a group is denigrated for a laugh. Chris Rock, who has examined this issue in a documentary, should have known better.

multimedia.caption: Jada Pinkett Smith at the Academy Awards. Chris Rock remarked from the stage about the way she wore her hair.
Jada Pinkett Smith at the Academy Awards. Chris Rock remarked from the stage about the way she wore her hair.
Jada Pinkett Smith at the Academy Awards. Chris Rock remarked from the stage about the way she wore her hair.

results.title: ‘Meat the Future’ Review: The Growth of a ‘Clean Meat’ Start-Up
results.abstract: In her new film, the documentarian Liz Marshall depicts the rise of Upside Foods, a company that produces meat from animal cells.

multimedia.caption: Uma Valeti, the leader of Upside Foods, who is taking animals out of the process of meat production, in the documentary from Liz Marshall.

results.title: With Discovery merger pending, Warner Bros. chief Ann Sarnoff is set to leave.
results.abstract: Ms. Sarnoff became the first woman to hold the job in 2019, but Discovery’s C.E.O. is expected to take over at least some of her role himself.

multimedia.caption: Ann Sarnoff became chief executive of Warner Bros. in 2019 despite limited Hollywood experience.

results.title: Estelle Harris, George’s Mother on ‘Seinfeld,’ Dies at 93
results.abstract: Employing a high-powered screech, she took maternal exasperation and paranoia to comedic heights as one of the show’s most frequently recurring characters.

results.title: Michelle Materre, Champion of Black Independent Film, Dies at 67
results.abstract: Through her distribution company and an educational series, Ms. Materre was for decades a tireless advocate for underrepresented filmmakers.

results.title: A Slap Could Sting the Smith Family Brand
results.abstract: Will Smith has spent decades radiating boundless likability. His family has become known for sharing therapy sessions online. His smack at the Oscars has complicated all of that.
results.byline: By Melena Ryzik, Nicole Sperling and Matt Stevens

multimedia.caption: After slapping the comedian Chris Rock live on stage at the Academy Awards, Will Smith won the Oscar for best actor and delivered a teary acceptance speech.
After slapping the comedian Chris Rock live on stage at the Academy Awards, Will Smith won the Oscar for best actor and delivered a teary acceptance speech.

results.title: Using Film to Tell a Personal History of America and Race
results.abstract: With “Who We Are,” the lecturer Jeffery Robinson and the directors Emily and Sarah Kunstler follow in the tradition of documentaries that excavate our past.

results.abstract: A new series of adaptations, documentaries and more examines the different ways the composer-lyricist left his mark on movies.

results.title: Jerrod Carmichael Comes Out in a Riveting Special That’s About So Much More
results.abstract: In “Rothaniel” on HBO, the stand-up grapples with secrets that defined his upbringing, the toll silence has taken and the price he’s paying to break it.

results.title: Will Smith Resigns From Academy After Slapping Chris Rock at Oscars
results.abstract: The producer of the telecast, Will Packer, said that Smith had been asked to leave after slapping Rock, and that he had urged officials not to “physically remove” the actor.

results.title: ‘The Bubble’ Review: Swabs, Camera, Action
results.abstract: Judd Apatow’s new film is a comedy about actors trying to make a dinosaur movie during the pandemic that plays more like a documentary of actors trying to make a Covid comedy.

results.title: Paul Herman, Mainstay of Gangster Movies, Is Dead at 76
results.abstract: Over a four-decade career, he was perhaps best known for his role on “The Sopranos.” But he also had dozens of film credits, including “Goodfellas” and “The Irishman.”
results.byline: By Mike Ives and Alex Traub

multimedia.caption: Paul Herman, left, with James Gandolfini in an episode of “The Sopranos.” Mr. Herman was a member of the show’s cast for three seasons.

results.title: ‘The Contractor’ Review: The Pine Identity

results.title: ‘Babi Yar: Context’ Review: Unearthing Footage of a Nazi Massacre
results.abstract: Sergei Loznitsa’s new documentary, about the mass murder of Ukrainian Jews in 1941, arrives in theaters with a grim context of its own.
